title: Hazel Valley Gran Prix 2017
description: A FREE supported ride! About 55 miles of challenging gravel roads. About 4-6 hours of saddle love. Several 30+ minute climbs with a incredible view atop White Rock Mountain. This IS a ride. NOT a race. IT IS AN ADVENTURE!
course: 55 miles of gravel roads. 5,000+ elevation gain!
registration:
FREE!

Participants must sign a waiver.
directions:
Hazel Valley Ranch is 30 minutes southeast of Fayetteville.

16330 Olive Rd, Fayetteville, AR 72701

title: HWY 71 CLASSIC
description: Bicycle tour on open roads in Northwest Arkansas benefiting bike advocacy
course:
32 miles on HWY 71 Business Fayetteville - Brentwood -Fayetteville
71 miles on HWY 71 Business  Fayetteville - Mountainburg - Fayetteville
registration: Online registration for $30 or day of registration $40
notes:
This annual ride and fundraiser supports non-profit advocacy efforts to create a more bike-friendly Northwest Arkansas through education and outreach programs for all users of the road and advocacy for bike infrastructure.
The fully supported 32-mile route is mostly flat, with the turn-around at the lovely Brentwood Park on the White River. The 71-mile out and back offers hundreds of feet of elevation change in several epic climbs on the way to Mountainburg and back. The turnaround point and aid station for the 72-mile ride is at the First Assembly of God church in Mountainburg.
Both routes feature refreshments and sag wagon support. We are excited to once again offer local food and beverages from Arsaga's Coffee Roastery, Stonemill Bread Company, and Ozark Natural Foods.
directions: Registration and departure from the parking lot at the corner of S Block Ave and E 13th St in Fayetteville, Arkansas.

title: Hell On the Border Criterium - AR State Crit
Slaughter Pen Jam Mt. Bike Festival
Cane Creek Timberland
description: The Cane Creek Timberland is a Mountain Bike race in Southeastern Arkansas that displays the unique flora and fauna along an easy to moderate course. Riders will enjoy the fast paced trail riding while moving swiftly along this 8-mile wooded track.
course: The course is an 8 mile course along the edges of the Gulf Coastal Plain and the Mississippi Alluvial Delta. The course is easy to moderate in difficulty.
registration: Men’s CAT 1 ($45) will start as a unified field and payout will be in accordance to AMBCS rules. Women’s CAT 1($45) and Women’s CAT 2($40) will start as a unified field and payout will be in accordance to AMBCS rules. Men’s CAT 2 ($40) will start in heats as normal. Men and Women CAT 3 will race for $35 entry fee. Juniors will race for a $20 entry fee.
notes:
Race Director contact info is:
Seth Boone
Seth.Boone@arkansas.gov
870-578-2064
directions: From Star City, travel south on Highway 425 and then take a left onto Highway 293. The park is 5 miles down the road on the left. Registration will be at Pavilion 1.
